title: YOU CAN'T WON
comment: TITLE,WON'T LET ME WIN(seriously,major bug here,it's not that i'm stupid so that i "can't" win,it's that you're just UNABLE because of the bug,whenever i made my winning move,the game still continue  no fun because of it,no sense of achievement yadda yadda pls fix
Blue has to connect blue's lines. Red connects red's. Make sure you (if blue) aren't trying to connect red (or vise versa).

title: Great game with a few app problems
comment: The game is actually fantastic, however, I have been running into some issues since the UI update (sometime around summer 2013).  Leaving the game and going back to it will often cause the app to open up as just a white screen.  Going back from that to the home screen will (after a few times) eventually cause the app to close and be able to be re-opened to the start screen with the game lost.  I'm still glad to have the app on android, and everything is great when the error does not happen, but it does end up being pretty crippling when it does.

runs smoothly, great abstract strategy! formatting for 4" smartphone is a little funky with the bigger boards.

title: Poorly written. Never acknowledges win against computer
comment: Crashed at Google sign in. Forced quit to log back in. Attempted to play against computer and even when I have a legally winning move it allows the computer to play another and still win. Good game but please fix your obvious bugs and the bad How to Play URL. Coming from a Galaxy Nexus.

title: Challenging
comment: Works for me....

title: Amazing app, but...
comment: First the good:  This is hands down the best interface and feature set of any game on Android.  If this dev wants to make a dozen spinoffs in the Scrabble, Tetris, Bejeweled, etc. genres, he'll instantly have the best collection of online multiplayer games in the market and I will buy every one.  Downside?  This particular game concept basically reduces to a glorified tic tac toe.  For every scenario there is exactly one correct move, so strategy is reduced to cold math.

I think its after 9x9 that the game is no longer solved. And if you have Swap enabled, then even 7x7 isn't solved. I'm glad you like the interface - even I'm impressed with what Nick came up with. Building it took forever, haha... :]

title: Good idea game with fatal weakness
comment: Interesting idea for tictactoe likes game, unfortunately it seem has fatal weakness. Using hexagonal tile makes unfair advantageous moving for vertical player. I meant, vertical player always have two way to evade opponen but horizontal player had only one and easily to block. CMIIW I know many people had beat game, but still both side not in balance form start.
The board is actually symmetrical. I thought the same thing until my friend carefully drew it out and counted the hexagons for me.

title: Unfair and annoying.
comment: I found no fun in this game. Each move the CPU makes its annoying and unfair. I deleted this game in 2 minutes, and was unsatisfied.

title: Good game
comment: The gameplay is fine, the graphics are simple but snappy.  All around good game.  This could be QUITE fun with friends if there were enough people playing it, but I couldn't even get a quick game to match up.

title: As futile as tic tic toe
comment: Whoever goes first always wins. With a hexagonal board its guaranteed you will always have a route to the edge.
Haha, I assure you that's not the case.

title: Doesn't work
comment: Just crashes in android 4.3
You don't have the latest Play Store (for whatever reason). It crashes when trying to load the Play Services (achievements, cloud sync, multiplayer) features.

title: Nice, but needs improvements
comment: I could not sign in to my Google account. So no online games. Also, the swap is wrong, because the piece color is changed but the sides the players should connect are not swapped. Otherwise, the game is great.
The board is symmetric, so swapping the sides doesn't amount to much. Don't know why you can't sign into your Google account (sorry).

title: Poorly written.
comment: The game is nice, fluid, and works as intended, however, the game crashes nearly half the time whenever the AI has to go for it's finishing move.  The spinning menu is a nice touch.

Sorry, there are inconsistencies between devices and Android versions. It doesn't crash on the 2 or 3 devices I have access to, but that's not saying much since it crashes for you. I do fix the bugs as they pop up in the error log - when I get the time.

title: Addictive game
comment: Game became addictive within minutes of installing. But I'm unable to access multiplayer. I and my friend tried invites but nothing happens.

It should pop up with a request to play a game... :x It's a bit finicky. Try checking out Pending after an invite is sent. (If it's still not working, we can all blame Google. It's their match making code.)
Simple but great game.

title: Fabulous game!

Unfortunately due to low number of players online multiplayer is not very usable, although that should fix itself in time. And despite the many reviews that claim medium difficulty is rigged, it is still possible, just slightly tricky! Would appreciate it if the previous move glowed or something, so it can be spotted easily.
Mind boggling  game. Love it!

Stupid.
I'm sorry you feel that way.

title: To hard for me
comment: This is the kind of game I'd normally be really good at but after 25 games on easy I was still unable to beat the computer... This game is awesome but I uninstalled it out of pure frustration
Try it out with friends (or even strangers you see on the street). I'm sure you'll get a much better feel for it when you're learning with other people (I did at least).

title: AI is ridiculous
comment: "Easy" is to easy and "Medium" is insanely difficult.

title: First game I ever wanted to rage quit
comment: Awesome game, however insanely hard medium difficulty (I only won 6/36 games) and impossible to win if you play second

title: Fantastic concept, flawed buggy multiplayer
comment: When trying this game out at a mate's behest, I instantly fell in love with it. We tried out the Pass to Play function for a bit and I had a grand time. I got the game myself after noticing it had an online mode where I could continue to ream my friend over the net. Not surprisingly the game requires you log in to your Google account. Except whenever I click it the login button it freezes my device up and proceeds to flood me with errors. I really want to play this online but my device has now crashed.
Do you mind testing a beta build for me, to see if I've fixed the bug? It doesn't happen on any of the devices I have. Send me an email if you have the free time.
Very fun multiplayer!

title: Crash
comment: Crashes when trying to log in with google account,  please fix.

title: Highly addictive!
comment: Beautiful graphics, simple but addictive!

title: Rigged
comment: Good concept but AI on medium is impossible. Just like in tic toe there's just undeniable strategies. 7x7 grid makes you go first making it impossible to win. 9x9 grid makes you go first so its impossible to win. 11x11 grid is just one to small to win AND it always let's computer go first apparently so it can take the middle spot EVERY TIME to allow itself the exact room it needs. Really? Passed this game around to about 10 people and no one could beat the computer once. Rigged

Haha, it's beatable once you get a good feel for the game. Not easy though. It has a 50/50 chance of going first when you first start the game (if you then press restart, it keeps the order). First Move Swap lets Player2 play on top of Player1's first move - use that to your advantage as well.

title: Great
comment: Awesome and addicting game

title: Amazing UI
comment: One of the greatest UI.... we can't expect great ui with professional look in free apps.  Thanks to dev for spending your time for us without expecting anything from us... try to copyright the ui...

title: Nice idea, needs work
comment: Easy is too easy, medium is too hard. Needs some balancing, but PvP is cool, has potential

title: Brilliantly Designed!
comment: This game is really fascinating!  I personally am really bad at it, but that's part of what makes it so fun to play!  This game's UI has changed a lot recently, and it has a really innovative and professional navigation system!  The game has a great ascetic and I really haven't seen a similar concept much elsewhere.  Its also very well layed out for multiplayer, which is very impressive!  This is a great game, and I highly recommend it!

title: Very slow & very dumb AI
comment: Very slow & very dumb AI, even on the hardest level. And I'm NOT a strong player. When it was obvious that I'd win on my next turn (cause I had 2 possible squares), the AI kept thinking for as long as usual. So I decided to let it win to see how it would play : it delayed its last winning move not only once, but several times ! People here who claim the AI is strong must never have played a board game in their life. The dev must be aware of the prob since he set the board size to 7x7 by default. Try the 11x11 or more to see what I mean by slow. Also, the last move isn't indicated. I should rate 1 star but since it's free & open source...

title: Awesome!
comment: Possum!

title: I've only beat the computer one time
comment: Dang it is hard.
AI has a difficulty setting now

title: Wow!
comment: Excellent UI and a very simple premise.

title: Problems
comment: The wheel on the main menu stutters a lot on Galaxy S4, and yes, I am sure. The animation after I let go stutters a lot on my S4. Also, on the default board, AI is insanely good. I have not been able to win once.

Well, you can email me and I can send you an apk with a faster animation tick. Although it's already set to 30ms, which is pretty darn fast. I'd probably have you test a slower one too, in case it's the redraw call that's lagging. You have to understand - this is practically impossible for me to fix since I can't reproduce it.

title: Getting worse
comment: Previous ui was a 5-star, new "improved" "clever" ui removes much of the original charm. Never understand why people do this other than to show off their coding "skills"

Haha, alternatively... Hex was my first Android app and it was pretty messy under the hood. As we were cleaning it up, a friend sent us pictures of an alternative design everyone really liked. Thus, this update. They're no longer supported, but you can download older copies here: https://github.com/Xlythe/HexGame_Android/downloads

title: Good game!

title: Bad Ai Algorithms, UI
comment: Using 14x14, Ai is pathetically easy to beat. Computer "Bee" is broken (exponential time for larger size boards). Setting players "Will" vs "Will" causes game to freeze. Changing board size increases cell count but most of the screen is filled with border filler.   Please lookup professor Ryan Hayward for some hex algorithms to implement.
